title: Everyday appliances 'quietly adding' £100s to your annual energy bill, expert alerts
text:
An expert alerted that 'vampire appliances' could be adding hundreds of pounds to your annual energy bill without you even realising - but there are some simple steps to reduce the cost Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. More info
As the weather warms up and heating is turned off, most households anticipate a decrease in their energy bills. However, "vampire appliances" - everyday devices that continue to consume power even when switched off - are lurking in the background.
These unchecked devices could silently add as much as £100 to your annual energy bill, warns Stephen Day, a home energy expert and heating engineer at iHeat. He stated: "Most people have no idea that TVs, gaming consoles and even kitchen appliances keep drawing power when they're not in use.
"That little red standby light on your TV or the digital clock on a microwave may seem harmless, right? But over a year, it adds up fast."
A single TV left on standby, depending on the model, could waste around £5 to £10 a year in energy. Gaming consoles aren't much better,…
